text: The Parker Covered Bridge, near Upper Sandusky, Ohio, was built in 1873 and was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1975. It is located in Crane Township, Wyandot County, Ohio, about northeast of Upper Sandusky on Township Road 40A. It is a Howe truss covered bridge built by J.C. Davis. The bridge was burned on May 17, 1991 and was restored in 1993. It is in total length with span long. With 21 photos. It is covered in the Ohio Historic Places Dictionary. ==References== Category:Covered bridges in Ohio Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wyandot County, Ohio Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1873
title: Parker Covered Bridge
